unit_learning_outcomes.description: Identify, describe and evaluate a broad range of aspects of Polish-speaking cultures and societies.
Develop comprehensive advanced level skills in reading, writing, listening and speaking in the Polish language.
Create meaningful intercultural encounters by applying relevant language conventions.
Demonstrate a sophisticated awareness of language and language use, in both Polish and in English.
Identify, evaluate and deploy a broad range of grammatical structures of Polish at Advanced level.

data.description: Engagement with authentic Polish texts is vital for the development of knowledge about the language and the socio-political background of its production. This online unit focuses on the close analysis of a series of Polish literary and non-literary texts. The unit is divided into two parts: the first part develops skills in reading and writing about Polish literary texts; the second deals with Polish newspaper articles to help students appreciate how the ideas are conveyed through newspaper discourse to present, and comment on, contemporary issues in Poland. Alongside developing critical reading skills and competence in interpretative analysis, this unit aims to equip students with an in-depth knowledge of grammar and vocabulary that broadly aligns with B2+ level in the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL).
